name: Virat Kohli
achievements: Holds the record for scoring the most centuries in ODI cricket with 51 centuries.
Named the male cricketer of the decade by the International Cricket Council in 2020.
Won the ICC ODI Player of the Year award four times (2012, 2017, 2018, 2023).
Scored a record 765 runs in a single edition of the 2023 World Cup, named Player of the Tournament.
Led India to victory in the 2024 T20 World Cup and 2025 Champions Trophy.

name: Rohit Sharma
achievements: Scored the highest individual score in a One Day International match with 264 against Sri Lanka on 13 November 2014.
The only player to have scored three double-centuries in ODIs.
Became the first batsman to score five centuries in a single Cricket World Cup in 2019.
Holds the record for the most centuries in World Cup history with seven, achieved on 11 October 2023.
Named ICC Men's ODI Cricketer of the Year in 2019.

name: Shakib Al Hasan
achievements: Fastest player to achieve the double of 5,000 runs and 250 wickets in ODIs.
Scored 606 runs in the 2019 ICC Cricket World Cup, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's record for most runs in the group stage.
First Bangladeshi to score a century and take five wickets in the same Test match.
All-time highest wicket-taker in ICC Men's T20 World Cup as of 2025.
Named in the ICC Men's ODI Team of the Year twice (2009, 2021).

name: Tamim Iqbal
achievements: First Bangladeshi to score 10,000, 11,000, 12,000, 13,000, and 14,000 international runs.
Only Bangladeshi cricketer to score centuries in all three formats of the game.
Highest run-scorer for Bangladesh in international cricket, including Test, ODIs, and second in T20Is.
Named one of Wisden Cricketers' Almanack's four Cricketers of the Year and Wisden's Test Player of the Year in 2011.
Most 100s in international cricket for Bangladesh with 25 centuries across all formats.

name: Babar Azam
achievements: Fastest Asian batter to reach 11,000 runs in international cricket.
Holds the record for the most runs in the first 25 innings of his ODI career (1,306 runs).
Fastest player to score 5,000 runs in ODIs (97 innings).
Scored the most runs for Pakistan in a single World Cup (474 runs in 2019).
First Pakistani captain to beat India in a World Cup match.

name: Shaheen Afridi
achievements: Won the ICC Men's Cricketer of the Year in 2021 and became the first Pakistani to receive the Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy.
Youngest bowler to take a five-wicket haul in a World Cup match, with figures of 6/35 against Bangladesh in 2019.
Fastest Pakistani bowler to reach 100 wickets in ODIs, achieving the feat in 51 matches.
Led Lahore Qalandars to three Pakistan Super League titles in 2022, 2023, and 2025.
First Pakistani to reach 100 wickets in all three formats of international cricket and the youngest to do so.

name: David Warner
achievements: First Australian cricketer in 132 years to be selected for the national team without first-class cricket experience.
Holds the record for the most international centuries as an opening batsman across all formats.
Scored a triple century (335 not out) against Pakistan in 2019, the second-highest individual score for an Australian Test batsman.
Named Player of the Tournament in the 2021 T20 World Cup, scoring 289 runs.
Became the first batsman to score two 150+ scores in a Cricket World Cup during the 2019 tournament.

name: Pat Cummins
achievements: Youngest Australian Test cricketer since Ian Craig in 1953, debuting at 18 years and 193 days.
Led Australia to win the 2023 ICC Cricket World Cup, defeating India in the final.
Captained Australia to victory in the 2021–23 ICC World Test Championship.
Became the first fast bowler to be appointed full-time Australian Test captain in November 2021.
Took two hat-tricks across consecutive international matches during the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

name: Joe Root
achievements: Second highest run-scorer of all time in Test cricket.
Holds the record for most Test (39) and ODI (18) centuries for England.
Became the second batsman for England to score 10,000 Test runs in June 2022.
Part of the England team that won the 2019 Cricket World Cup, topping the scores for England.
Holds the world record for the highest fourth-wicket stand in Tests (454) with Harry Brook.

name: Ben Stokes
achievements: Man of the Match in the final of the 2019 Cricket World Cup.
Second-fastest Test double hundred in terms of balls faced.
Highest number of sixes in a Test career.
Most runs in a Test innings at the sixth position – 258 runs.
Highest Test partnership for the sixth wicket with Jonny Bairstow, achieving 399 runs against South Africa.

name: Kane Williamson
achievements: Became New Zealand's all-time leading run-scorer in Test cricket on 27 February 2023.
Captained New Zealand to victory in the 2021 ICC World Test Championship final.
Led New Zealand to the finals of the 2019 Cricket World Cup and 2021 T20 World Cup.
Scored 33 Test centuries and 15 ODI centuries as of March 2025.
Awarded Player of the Tournament in the 2019 Cricket World Cup, scoring 578 runs in 10 matches.

name: Trent Boult
achievements: Joint leading wicket-taker at the 2015 Cricket World Cup.
Became the third New Zealand bowler to take a hat-trick in ODIs in November 2018.
First New Zealand bowler to take a hat-trick in the Cricket World Cup in June 2019.
Took his 300th wicket in Test cricket in January 2022.
Named in the 'Team of the Tournament' for the 2015 World Cup by the ICC.
